reviews.review: What a masterpiece... IMO EASILY better than any other comic book movie.
It is one of the best movies of marvel.

After a decade waiting for Thanos..I was not disappointed in the slightest! Giving this movie a lower score then black panther shows true Hollywood bias. Just like real life..Its about everyone working together to stop great evil. And Marvel pulled out all the stops bring us full tilt to the Avengers3 Can not wait for Marvel studios Phase 4
Very enjoyable, leaving waiting for the next one. Great character development of Thanos (in comparison with most other villains seen in movies).
The Guardians of the Galaxy save thi s movie from being too much of a punch fest. Good fun all around.

Absolutely epic movie. Totally lived up to the hype of 10 years in the making. Can't say much without spoiling the movie but I'll say it was amazing. Tense action, humor, suspense, and drama all in one movie. The MCU really out did themselves and they deserve high praise for their work. Thank you for providing an experience I'll never forget when I watched it during Thursday previews.

If you're a casual watcher of "superhero" movies you may enjoy this. If you're a fan of the MCU like I used to be before I watched Avengers: Infinity War, I suggest you skip this. I wish I could get the last three hours of my life back. I won't be giving any more of my time or money to Marvel.
Meh. It was too long. Jumped to too many places. Not satisfied. Probably would be better viewed with the next one, from home on the couch.

One of the best action/sci-fi action films I’ve ever seen. I didn’t expect this movie to be so emotionally gripping. These aren’t just random action scenes sown together, it’s a series of scenes of characters protecting what they hold dear. It’s one of the most entertaining 2 hours you can spend watching a film. It isn’t just another superhero film, it’s beyond that. The ending to this movie has definitely left an impact on me.

Controversial to some and pleasing to fans. The culmination of ten years of cinematic storytelling, that manages to keep the soul of what has come before it while simultaneously bringing something wholly new to the table. Claimed by many as a 'mish mash of several movies in one', this feeling evokes nausea for casual moviegoers yet giddiness and a sense of wonder for avid comic book readers.
